dcterms:creator: J. Beirlant
Y. Goegebeur
J. Segers
J.L. Teugels
dcterms:description: The data set is obtained from a traffic sensor and has 2500 readings from July 10, 2015, to September 17, 2015, with eight marked anomalies.
dcterms:title: Vehicular Travel Time

dcterms:creator: J. Beirlant
Y. Goegebeur
J. Segers
J.L. Teugels
dcterms:description: The data set contains the average speed of all vehicles passing through the traffic detector. A total of 1128 readings for the period September 8, 2015 - September 17, 2015, is available. There are three marked unusual sub sequences in the data set.
dcterms:title: Vehicular Speed

dcterms:creator: J. Beirlant
Y. Goegebeur
J. Segers
J.L. Teugels
dcterms:description: There are a total of 2382 readings indicating the percentage of the time, during a 30-second period, that the detector sensed a vehicle. The data is available for a period of 17 days, from September 1, 2015, to September 17, 2015, and has two marked anomalies.
dcterms:title: Vehicular Occupancy

dcterms:description: The publicly available data set contains the pick-up locations and time stamps of street hailing yellow taxi services from the period of January 1, 2016, to February 29, 2016. We pick three time-sequences with clearly evident anomalies from data aggregated over 15 minute time periods in 1 km grids.
dcterms:title: New York City Taxi Demand

dcterms:description: This data set is obtained from a private taxi service provider in Bengaluru, India and has GPS traces of passengers booking a taxi by logging into the service providerâ€™s mobile application. Similar to the New York City data set, this data is also available for January and February 2016. We aggregate the data over 15 minute periods in 1 km grids and pick three sequences with clearly visible anomalies.
dcterms:title: Bengaluru Taxi Demand

dcterms:creator: E. Keogh
J. Lin
A. Fu
dcterms:description: There are a total of 18000 readings, with three unusual sub sequences labeled as anomalies. The data set has a repeating pattern, with some variability in the period length.
dcterms:title: Electrocardiogram (ECG)

dcterms:creator: J. Beirlant
Y. Goegebeur
J. Segers
J.L. Teugels
dcterms:description: This data set contains temperature sensor readings from an internal component of a large industrial machine. The readings are for the period between December 2, 2013, to February 19, 2014. There are a total of 22695 readings taken every 5 minutes, consisting of four anomalies with known causes.
dcterms:title: Machine Temperature
